name: New Hope Village Apartments - Cumberland River Comprehensive Care Center
description: New Hope Village Apartments is a transitional housing program operated by Cumberland River Behavioral Health, a nonprofit community mental health center serving the region since 1966. The program provides transitional housing for mentally ill men and women at 401 Roy Kidd Avenue in Corbin, Kentucky. This is a 17-bed fully staffed residential program designed to help individuals transition from homelessness to stable housing. The facility is part of Cumberland River Behavioral Health's comprehensive mental health and substance abuse services, which include individual, group, and family counseling, psychiatric evaluation, medication management, and crisis intervention services. The organization serves Bell, Clay, Harlan, Jackson, Knox, Laurel, Rockcastle, and Whitley counties.
source: Verified from official website and multiple government sources
